snippet: The maker of the baby formula Enfamil had been accused by the Chinese authorities of price-fixing and anticompetitive practices.
abstract: Mead Johnson Nutrition, maker of baby formula Enfamil, agrees to pay $83 million in connection with Chinese investigation into possible price-fixing and anticompetitive practices; China's National Development and Reform Commission has assessed administrative penalties against Mead Johnson and number of other milk formula companies doing business in nation.
lead_paragraph: The maker of the baby formula Enfamil had been accused by the Chinese authorities of price-fixing and anticompetitive practices.

headline.main: Mead Johnson Settles With China Over Price-Fixing
headline.print_headline: Mead Johnson Settles With China Over Price-Fixing
